alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 22 at 4:17AM MST until August 22 at 9:09PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River At Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Duncan...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Gila River At Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Major Flood Stage: Large sections of Duncan flood including the business district and residences. Highway 70 may be underwater in some sections. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM MST Monday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest 22 feet. It will then fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 900 AM MST.
